message_1: A company needs to transport 1000 tons of goods from Location A to Location B through a network of roads. Each road has a maximum capacity of 200 tons. Using network flow optimization, determine the minimum number of trips required to transport all the goods from Location A to Location B.
message_2:
To determine the minimum number of trips required to transport all the goods from Location A to Location B, we can simply divide the total amount of goods (1000 tons) by the maximum capacity of each road (200 tons).

1000 tons / 200 tons = 5 trips

Therefore, the minimum number of trips required to transport all the goods from Location A to Location B is 5 trips.
